intro: Portulaca latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf portulaca, is an annual flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that bloom in shades of red, yellow, and orange. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its ability to store water in its thick leaves allows it to survive in dry conditions. Portulaca latifolia is also known for its medicinal properties, used in traditional remedies for various ailments.
